examples: I yelled at the dogs to make them go away.
I really missed her when she went away.
When are you going back to your house?
I'll have to go back for my umbrella.
We can always go back to the original plan if necessary.

en: to move past, in space or time

examples: We go by the coffee shop everyday.
You can watch the trains going by from this window.
You can't let an opportunity like that go by - it's too good to miss.
The house was a train station in days gone by.
Could you buy a paper for me if you go by a newsagents?
Interest rates are going down at the moment.
The cost of flight tickets is going down.

en: to try to have or achieve something

examples: What sort of printer are you going to go for?
He'll be going for his third straight Olympic gold medal.
He tripped as he was going for the ball.
I don't really go in for sports.

en: to last for a particular period of time

examples: The film seemed to go on forever.
We can't go on living like this.

en: to use a piece of information to help you discover or understand something

examples: Her first name was all we had to go on.
